text: Grace!
Come in the house, it's time to go to bed.
But Mozes, I'm not sleepy yet. I don't wanna!
It's going to be dark soon, you have to.
Aw man!
Mommy and daddy always allowed me to stay outside after dark!
Heh, that's not entirely true, but come, you must listen to me now.
Okay ...
I'm sorry Grace, but after mother and father died, you know it's not safe here in the village anymore after dark. Orcs sometimes come in the village and I don't want to lose you too.
Boohoo! I miss mommy and daddy!
Me too Grace, me too.
Anyway, not only is it going to be dark, it's also past your bedtime, so in your bed you belong.
But I really wanna play outside!
And I'm not afraid of the dark.
Tomorrow you may play outside again, when it's safe.
But ...
No more buts. You go to sleep now.
I love you. Sweet dreams.
Love you too.
Good morning Grace. Did you sleep well?
Grace?
Grace, where are you?
Is she gone?
She knows better than to leave without telling me.
I hope she didn't run off again.
It's still dangerous outside the village.
Oh no! I have to make sure.
I'll get my sword, hopefully I don't need it.
Mrs. Johanna!
Have you seen Grace?
I am sorry dear, I have not seen Grace this morning.
Is something the matter?
I don't know where she is.
She wasn't in her bed this morning.
Maybe she went north? She likes to go there.
I'm afraid she did, there are orcs there.
I will ask around if perhaps someone else saw her.
Please do, I'll go north.
What was that loud noise?
Dang! That's just great.
Umph! I can't get it out of the way.
Now I can't return.
Well, there's nothing I can do about that now.
The people of the village will remove it soon probably,
at least I hope so.
I have to find Grace first.
